@graph.name: Vegan Tuna Salad with Chickpeas - Vegan Heaven
@graph.description: This vegan tuna salad with chickpeas is not only great on its own but also on a sandwich paired with tomato, lettuce, and cucumber.

@graph.headline: Vegan Tuna Salad with Chickpeas
@graph.keywords: chickpea tuna salad,vegan chickpea salad,vegan chickpea sandwich,vegan tuna,vegan tuna chickpea sandwich,vegan tuna salad,vegan tuna sandwich,vegan tuna with chickpeas,vegan tuna with seaweed

@graph.name: Vegan Tuna Sandwich
@graph.description: This vegan tuna salad with chickpeas is not only great on its own but also on a sandwich paired with tomato, lettuce, and cucumber.
recipeIngredient: 3-4 tablespoons store-bought or homemade vegan mayonnaise
2 teaspoons dried seaweed or kelp granules
1/2 teaspoon guar gum (if you don't got guar gum, you can also leave it out and double the amount of oil instead)

recipeInstructions.text: Make the mayonnaise: In a blender, combine all ingredients except the oil and the guar gum and let it sit for 1-2 minutes. Then blend on high until smooth. Add the guar gum and slowly stream in the oil. Blend until the mixture slowly thickens.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the mayonnaise: In a blender, combine all ingredients except the oil and the guar gum and let it sit for 1-2 minutes. Then blend on high until smooth. Add the guar gum and slowly stream in the oil. Blend until the mixture slowly thickens.

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the shredded dried seaweed in water for about 5 minutes. Then finely chop it.
recipeInstructions.name: Soak the shredded dried seaweed in water for about 5 minutes. Then finely chop it.

recipeInstructions.text: Mash the chickpeas with a fork until they have a flaky texture.  Stir in the celery, mayonnaise, dill, seaweed, and onions and season with soy sauce, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Mash the chickpeas with a fork until they have a flaky texture.  Stir in the celery, mayonnaise, dill, seaweed, and onions and season with soy sauce, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve on whole wheat toast with tomato, cucumber, and lettuce or eat by itself.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve on whole wheat toast with tomato, cucumber, and lettuce or eat by itself.
